chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating A Motor Vehicle Without Owner's Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Xylon S Harrison

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Xylon S Harrison in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Xylon S Harrison.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered case DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Xylon S Harrison in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Xylon S Harrison.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing. Plea hearing proceeded. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing due to defendant's use of marijuana within 24 hour period. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court in trial on another matter; case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 36; both parties agreed to date and time. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Xylon S Harrison in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin, by zoom.
Case in court for return on warrant.  Court vacated bench warrant.  Defendant has another case 22CF1740; Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent to represent defendant on both cases.  Defense waived preliminary hearing.  Prelimary hearing and questionnaire & waiver received and filed.  Defense requested projected plea and sentencing date.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 36.  All other previously set terms and conditions of bail to continue; Justice Point Pretrial Services Level 3 Supervision, and no contact order.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Bench Warrant Cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff.  Original (Copy) bench warrant received.  Case calendared for Return on Warrant August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defendant failed to appear.  Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued with REMAND TO JUDGE upon return of the bench warrant. Court took no action on bail.  Court will cancel warrant if defendant returns to court.
Court rescheduled Indigency Hearing to August 11, 2022 at 8:30 AM at the request of the State.  Parties notified of next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Discharge Report 8-8-2022

Defendant Xylon S Harrison in court, appear in person.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Defendant is NOT eligible for out services. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a indigency hearing in the trial court.  Indigency hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-8-2022
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report - 07-25-2022

Defendant Xylon S Harrison in court. Case in court for preliminary hearing. Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness was not present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that this matter be set in the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing or in the alternative that it be set for status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court advised defendant to make all Justice Points appointments.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Lincoln Park Golf Course.

Defendant Xylon S Harrison in court with Student Intern Meghan Devol under the supervision of Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Xylon S Harrison in custody.  Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Xylon S Harrison appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case 22CF1740 pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
